Description: Writing-board with hieratic inscription of personal names of people from the island of Crete. The text starts ‘Making the names of the Keftiw (Cretans)’ followed by phonetically spelled names. These phonetic spellings of Cretan names provide a glimpse of the language spoken in Crete and show how foreign words were accurately recorded.
Curator's comments: See Peet 1927. The Cretan words are considered in Kyriakidis 2002, 217-8. Bibliography: Kyriakidis, E. 2002, 'Indications on the nature of the language of the Keftiw from Egyptian sources', Ägypten und Levante XII, 211-19. Peet, T.E. 1927, 'The Egyptian writing-board B.M. 5647, bearing Kettiu names', in S. Casson (ed.), Essays in Aegean presented to Sir Arthur Evans in honour of his 75th birthday (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 90-9. Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, p. 158
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
